Title: For Those About To Rock We Salute You
ReviewText: A masterpiece of hard rock. The title track is an anthem that defines a generation. A must-have for any AC/DC fan.

Title: Balls to the Wall
ReviewText: Pure, unadulterated 80s metal. 'Balls to the Wall' is an iconic track, though some of the other tracks on the album feel like filler.

Title: Let There Be Rock
ReviewText: AC/DC in their rawest form. 'Whole Lotta Rosie' and the title track are relentless. A true classic.

Title: Big Ones
ReviewText: A solid greatest hits collection from Aerosmith. All the essentials are here, from 'Walk On Water' to 'Crazy'.

Title: Jagged Little Pill
ReviewText: Defined the 90s. Alanis Morissette's raw vocals and honest lyrics on tracks like 'You Oughta Know' are timeless.

Title: Facelift
ReviewText: The birth of a new sound. 'Man In The Box' and 'We Die Young' set the stage for the entire grunge movement.

Title: Audioslave
ReviewText: What happens when you combine the power of Soundgarden's vocals with the rhythm of RATM? This. 'Cochise' and 'Like a Stone' are legendary.

Title: Greatest Kiss
ReviewText: A decent collection, but it misses some key live tracks. Good for a casual fan, but die-hards will notice omissions.

Title: Unplugged
ReviewText: Perhaps the most famous acoustic performance ever. The 'Layla' rework is iconic. Clapton's playing is masterful.

Title: Appetite for Destruction
ReviewText: Arguably the greatest debut album in rock history. Not a single weak track. 'Welcome to the Jungle' is an explosive opener.

Title: The Number of The Beast
ReviewText: The album that made Iron Maiden legends. Bruce Dickinson's vocals are incredible. 'Hallowed Be Thy Name' is a masterpiece.

Title: Greatest Hits
ReviewText: Lenny Kravitz's hits are undeniable. 'Are You Gonna Go My Way' and 'Fly Away' are stadium anthems.

Title: Black Album
ReviewText: The album that took Metallica from a thrash band to the biggest band in the world. 'Enter Sandman' and 'Nothing Else Matters' are flawless.

Title: Kill 'Em All
ReviewText: Raw, fast, and aggressive. This is the blueprint for thrash. 'Seek & Destroy' is a live staple for a reason.

Title: Master Of Puppets
ReviewText: The album that defined thrash metal. 'Master Of Puppets' is an 8-minute epic, and 'Battery' is pure aggression. A perfect album.

Title: Nevermind
ReviewText: The album that changed everything. 'Smells Like Teen Spirit' is the anthem of a generation. The raw power is still unmatched.

Title: Ten
ReviewText: A flawless debut. 'Alive', 'Jeremy', and 'Black' are three of the most powerful rock songs ever recorded. Essential listening.

Title: Blood Sugar Sex Magik
ReviewText: The Red Hot Chili Peppers at their peak. The funk and rock fusion is perfect. 'Under The Bridge' and 'Give It Away' are classics.

Title: Achtung Baby
ReviewText: U2 completely reinvented themselves. Dropping their earnest image for a darker, industrial sound. 'One' and 'Mysterious Ways' are highlights.

Title: 20th Century Masters - The Millennium Collection: The Best of Scorpions
ReviewText: Has 'Rock You Like a Hurricane' and 'No One Like You', but is missing many deeper cuts. A very surface-level collection.
